channel.title: DHCPv6 on JWillikers
channel.description: Recent content in DHCPv6 on JWillikers

item.title: IPv6 on OpenBSD
item.description: Configuring IPv6 on my OpenBSD home router was a much more difficult task than I’d expected. While this was mostly due to the steep learning curve of IPv6 and DHCPv6, OpenBSD doesn’t provide DHCPv6 support in its native DHCP daemon. I’ve documented my setup and difficulties here in the hope it saves some time for someone else. Configuration I configured IPv6 on on my home router running OpenBSD 6.
